channel.title: My client does not want to unpack its media?
channel.description: I recently downloaded a cache editor. I changed the mod crowns to my own custom mod crowns. I compiled and got no errors. But now my client won't unpack the media. I keep trying to open the cache but it never does so I can't remove the crowns. What can I do?

item.title: My client does not want to unpack its media?
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Well, if you clicked + and added a couple of crowns that way without adding the code to correspond with it clientside then you shouldn’t be able to open your cache and will either have to add the code to your client class which enables crowns up to player rights 4 for if you added 2 crowns, rights 3 if you added 1 etc… but otherwise you’re going to have to use a backup cache you have and if you don’t have that and are unable to do the crown code you’ll have to restart but I’ll see if I can find the tutorial for adding crowns through the cache for you.

Read full topic
item.source: My client does not want to unpack its media?

item.title: My client does not want to unpack its media?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

Too big as in image dimensions?
Or as in disk space?

I clicked the + button.
Is my cache f***ed?

Read full topic
item.source: My client does not want to unpack its media?

item.title: My client does not want to unpack its media?
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

I Vain I, it does sound like a damaged cache but I wouldn’t rule anything else out quite yet. kicker, I would try changing your batch file to:

@echo off COLOR 08 title Runescape's Ecstacy client V3 @echo Client Is loading...... @echo ----------------------- java -Xmx1024m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 highmem members 32 pause

Also, check to make sure the crowns you added aren’t too big. One last thing that I know could’ve gone wrong would’ve been if you added the crowns wrong as in if you hit the + symbol and actually ADDED crowns to the cache instead of overwriting the ones that were already in it.

Read full topic

@kicker862 wrote:

@echo off
COLOR 08
title Runescape’s Ecstacy client V3
@echo Client Is loading…
@echo -----------------------
java -Xmx1000m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 highmem members 32
pause

item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

well, obviously there is a memory usage error. There could be a few problems although that error isn’t very specific at all. Could you post the contents of the batch file you use to run your client?

item.title: My client does not want to unpack its media?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

Both.
I used that cache suite.
I was able to open the media sprites before.
I added the crowns and saved.
I closed the cache suite.
I compiled my client.
I ran it and it just crashed at “unpacking media”
So both are happening to me.
I cant open sprites and client keeps crashing

Read full topic
item.source: My client does not want to unpack its media?

item.title: My client does not want to unpack its media?
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Do you mean that with Tom’s Cache Suite you can’t open the “Media” sprites and are therefore unable to edit any sprites or do you mean that you run your client and it crashes at “Unpacking Media” during the loadup?
